pages.text: The $(item)Sticky Head$() is the quintessential head you'll stick on an $(l:engineering/automaton)Automaton$(). As the name implies, it has a sticky front, and can rotate blocks around the axis of the $(item)Automaton$().$(br2)Simply put, when an $(item)Automaton$() with this head is up, and is rotated, whichever block is in front will rotate alongside it.

It's worth noting that $(item)Obsidian$() or other very hard blocks are equally immune to the $(item)Sticky Head$() as they are to standard $(item)Pistons.$()$(br2)Attempting to move an unmovable block, or to rotate into an obstruction while the head is up (regardless of whether it's carrying a block or not), will cause the $(item)Automaton$() to block, until the problem is fixed.
Any type of wood may be used to craft the $(item)Sticky Head$().
